True to its name, this Portland, Oregon quintet combines rock, bluegrass and folk to blend into an earthy and fulfilling whole. They have written a batch of them here, of which the moody Ã¢â‚¬Å“Blue LightÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ finds the swamp rock lurking under the surface and the lovely and lively Ã¢â‚¬Å“Mountain AnnieÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ flows like a burbling country brook. The latter features a chorus perfect for audience sing-alongs as the melody soars, riding on an effortless interplay between acoustic guitar and mandolin.

This is Americana of the highest order, driven by charming three-part harmonies that never feel forced. Mimi Naja, who contributes piano along with her sprightly mandolin, also shines as a tough, husky voiced lead vocalist, a role she inhabits all too seldom on these eleven tunes.
